programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show

programme.sub-title: It's a Shame She Married Me

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.sub-title: A Surprise Surprise Is a Surprise
programme.desc: Laura despairs when Rob learns of her elaborate plans to throw a surprise party for him.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Sally gets a marriage proposal from an opportunistic comedian who wants her to write his material.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.sub-title: When a Bowling Pin Talks, Listen
programme.desc: Rob finds himself in hot water after inadvertently lifting a comedy idea from another show.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob bids on and wins an ugly clown painting that covers another work beneath, perhaps a masterpiece.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob would like to know why Laura disappears every time his insurance agent comes over or calls.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob and Laura unintentionally eavesdrop on the Helpers prior to attending their dinner party.

programme.sub-title: Very Old Shoes, Very Old Rice
programme.desc: Rob and Laura, having learned they are not legally married, make plans to elope.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob finds himself trapped between casting Laura as this year's leading woman or a talented newcomer.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.sub-title: Who and Where Was Antonio Stradivarius?
programme.desc: Rob finds himself at a party in a strange town, dancing with a young woman.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob's energetic Uncle George comes for a visit to eagerly pressure Rob into finding him a wife.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: A man with suspected underworld connections asks Rob, Sally and Buddy to write a comedy routine.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob feels very much the hero when he hires a maid for his overworked wife, Laura.

programme.sub-title: The Sound of the Trumpets of Conscience Falls Deafly on a Brain That Holds Its Ears...
programme.desc: Rob struggles between his civic duty and fear for his family's safety.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: The entire "Alan Brady" staff presents a Christmas show instead of the script.

programme.sub-title: The Third One from the Left

programme.sub-title: The Lady and the Tiger and the Lawyer
programme.desc: When a handsome bachelor moves in next door, Rob and Laura become matchmakers.

programme.sub-title: The Life and Love of Joe Coogan

programme.sub-title: A Nice, Friendly Game of Cards

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.sub-title: Happy Birthday and Too Many More

programme.sub-title: The Pen Is Mightier Than the Mouth
programme.desc: Rob and Buddy find themselves overworked when Sally becomes a television personality overnight.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: When Laura fills in for Sally at the office, her performance exceeds everyone's expectations.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob recalls the hectic time of his Army marriage to Laura.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: At the insistence of an overbearing guest star, Rob takes over as producer of The Alan Brady Show.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: A scratch on Rob's new car causes a domestic crisis at the Petrie house.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob attempts to coax a legendary radio star out of retirement for a TV special.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: A painting of Laura resurfaces -- but this time she is not wearing any clothes.

programme.sub-title: Dear Mrs. Petrie, Your Husband Is In Jail

programme.sub-title: I'd Rather Be Bald Than Have No Head at All

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob is skeptical when Laura's new writing teacher thinks she shows promise.

programme.sub-title: The Sick Boy and The Sitter

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Laura dyes her hair blonde when she fears the romance in her marriage is fading.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob is torn between going to Washington, D.C. on business and attending Ritchie's school play.

programme.sub-title: Harrison B. Harding of Camp Crowder, MO

programme.desc: Laura begins to worry when Rob has to work nights with a beautiful television star.

programme.sub-title: To Tell or Not to Tell

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob fears he is no longer needed when his co-writers do a show without his help.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob invites 44 fellow PTA members to his television show, but forgets all about it until air time.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Laura is afraid to tell Rob that she doesn't like a necklace.

programme.desc: Rob and Buddy treat Sally as one of the guys, even in the presence of Sally's date.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show

programme.desc: Rob's pal Jerry strains their friendship when he starts knocking Rob's television show in public.
